Line isolated and spill path is being water washed with fresh clean water from the main water plant.  Depth of release was 4-5 feet below grade. all proper notifications have been made.
Line was 4 inch fiberglass line.  Joint failure.
properties.Preventative Measure: Line will be replaced with120 feet of 1000 pound rated new fiberglass.

properties.Spill_Desc: COGCC inspection (Doc No. 689501401) conducted based on land owner complaint (Doc # 403139090) and observation of stained soil on surface.  KPK crew investigated upon receiving the COGCC inspection and confirmed the stained soil is a result of a leak in the flowline.  The well was not operational at the time and there was not any liquid present.  No additional information available at this time as incident is to be investigated.
Dumpline failure was identified during pressure testing.

Western Midstream contacted KPK on 8/29/2022. KPK crews arrived on site on 8/29/2022 shortly after the report was made by Western Midstream and confirmed the flowline leak was KPKs'. KPK immediately proceeded to isolate the associated flowline segment and call in emergency locates.  A response crew was dispatched on 8/29/2022 with a backhoe and dump trailer.  A surface soil sample was collected from where the flowline leak daylighted along with a background surface soil sample adjacent to the visibly stained surface soils was also collected. A site sketch of the sample locations with GPS data are attached.  The source sample was submitted for analysis of Table 915-1 constituents while the background sample was submitted for metals analyses.  Once the leak had stopped, excavation of most heavily impacted soils began.  A supplemental form 19 will be submitted to document source removal activities.

We had a produced water (injection water) spill near the Carney 35X34 well.  API-05-103-07593.  SENE Section 34,T2N,R102W, 6TH P.M
Spill Location 40.103263, -108.824. Depth of release was approximately 4-5 feet deep.  Line was isolated and spill path will be water washed and all proper notifications have been made.  Cause and repair type unknow at this time and will be added to a supplemental form.
properties.Root Cause:
We had a produced water (injection water) spill near the Carney 35X34 well. API-05-103-07593. SENE Section 34,T2N,R102W, 6TH
P.M
Spill Location 40.103263, -108.824. Depth of release was approximately 4-5 feet deep. Line was isolated and spill path was water
washed and all proper notifications have been made.  Cause of failure was internal corrosion of 10 inch Corvel Coated pipe.
properties.Preventative Measure: Corvel Coated pipe with be replaced with Stainless Steel.

properties.Spill_Desc: Production personnel noticed lower line pressures than expected while conducting routine pressure testing on a condensate line that runs between the Fed 04 well pad and the Spruce Creek Tank Farm.  Upon further investigation of the pipeline ROW, a small wet spot (approx. 3-feet in diameter) was discovered in surface soils within the pipeline ROW at a distance of approximately 80-feet west of the produced water tank.  Immediately upon discovering the leak, the dump line was shut in, drained, and removed from service.  Utility locates have been completed, and a hydro-vac truck was used to positively locate the pipelines within the corridor.  Contaminated soils are currently being excavated and removed from around the leaking pipeline.  Contaminated soils exceeding standards are being hauled to an off-site disposal facility.  Contaminated soils will not be land-farmed on-site.  The impacted area will be cleaned up to comply with 915-1 cleanup standards, then backfilled with clean fill.
Operator arrived on location and identified the failed dumpline, fluid had com to the surface at the tank battery.

Spill was discovered morning of 9.8.22. It was stopped at the time. Cause of release in produced water line was failed fiberglass line. In the next day we will be removing any visibly impacted soils around the area and at depth and segregating for future landfill disposal.  Concurrently we will sample for table 915 B, as required and for NORM on the impacted soils. All locations identified as related to the location will also be removed and segregated to the best degree possible, then remaining areas sampled as  required to determine the remaining level of any impacts.

On Tuesday, August 13, 2022, KPK was notified that a third party contractor had contacted and damaged the off-facility flowline that runs from the Koshio 2 wellhead (API # 05-123-09305) to the KOSHIO-62N67W 36SENW facility.  KPK immediately responded and shut-in the Koshio 2 well.

The production foreman was completing pressure testing on the H21 well pad when he identified the H21 sales header failed pressure test.  Once the failed pressure test was identified the well pad was shut in for assessment.

During routine operations on the Kodak location, maintenance teams discovered a sheen on water inside containment. The spill source and volume is unknown and the investigation in ongoing. The spill was contained inside secondary containment.
Ft. Lupton FD responded to a call of a leak, KPK responded and shut in the wells, lines associated with the release.

A dumpline developed a subsurface leak leading to produced water daylighting to the surface. The line was immediately isolated and the fluid that surfaced was surrounded with berms. Emergency locates have been called in and remedial excavation will begin today, 9/20/22, or tomorrow, 9/21/22.
The Lease Operator discovered a leak through flow trending on the 1B flowline. The well has been shut in and hydro excavation is being scheduled.

On 9/21/2022 at approximately 19:00 on the Leffler 26-A Pad, the night operator noticed produced water surfacing above the dumpline corridor. The facility was immediately shut in and the produced water stopped surfacing. No produced water flowed off location. Upon review of production data it is estimated that 22 bbls of produced water were released. Clean up operations are underway and an investigation into the cause of the release is being determined. On 9/22/2022 one soil sample was collected for profiling purposes from the area suspected to be most impacted, which was determined by field screening via PID. The soil sample was submitted for laboratory analysis of all Table 915-1 contaminants.
properties.Root Cause: The 6" prefabricated "T" section at the common produced water dumpline downstream of the separators is what failed due to internal corrosion. It's suspected that the "T" section was made of a lesser quality steel.
properties.Preventative Measure: Additional pressure testing will be conducted following repairs. Alternative construction materials and chemical treatment options are being evaluated.

properties.Spill_Desc: Following identification of the first C23 8" waterline failure (Spill/Release Point ID #482619), Caerus was conducting pressure testing following the waterline repair and identified an additional point of release at this location.
properties.Root Cause: The point of release was determined to be due to internal corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: The pipeline will be repaired and pressure tested to prevent reoccurrence.

properties.Spill_Desc: Caerus was conducting pressure testing following identification and repair of the first and second C23 8" waterline failures points, when a third point of release was identified at this location.  The waterline was shut in and repairs are being made to the pipeline.
properties.Root Cause: The point of release was determined to be due to internal corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: The pipeline will be repaired and pressure tested.

properties.Spill_Desc: We had a produced water spill (injection water) at the Main Water Plant, P-1750 Suction Line.   Line was isolated and spill path will be water washed and all proper notifications have been made.  All standing/flowing fluids entered the emergency pit and will be recovered and put back into the injection system.  All fluids stayed inside the facility SPCC boundary.  Cause and repair plans are unknow at this time. Depth of the release was at ground level.
properties.Root Cause: We had a produced water spill (injection water) at the Main Water Plant, P-1750 Suction Line.   Line was isolated and spill path will be water washed and all proper notifications have been made.  All standing/flowing fluids entered the emergency pit and will be recovered and put back into the injection system.  All fluids stayed inside the facility SPCC boundary.  Failure was due to corrosion on a 12 inch steel line.
properties.Preventative Measure: Line will be replaced with Stainless Steel.

properties.Spill_Desc: Operator caught a flow line release with the use of trending pressures, confirm with a pressure test and gas monitor. operator isolated the flow line and reported to  EH&S On Call.

While Oxy Petroleum was potholing to remove a steel flowline from their Dacono State 17-36 location, they struck the KPK 2" poly flowline and caused a spill to occur.  Oxy was potholing to remove their flowline and when the line strike occurred, the fluids in the KPK flowline filled the pothole and followed the conduit created from the removed pipeline to the east and west approximately 40 feet in each direction where Oxy had existing excavations open from pothole and flowline removal activities.  KPK immediately shut-in the associated well (State 14 API No. 05-123-09466) and isolated the flowline.  No fluids left the line strike pothole.  Excavation of impacted soils began that afternoon and direct loaded into transports to landfill for disposal.  
Other notifications made but unable to populate in supplemental below were:
Nikki Graber and Kari Brown w/ COGCC on 10/7/22 at 1:47 pm via text w/ photos
John Lee w/ Frederick Investment Company (Landowner) on 10/7/22 at ~1:30pm via phone
properties.Root Cause: Tracer wire on poly line faulty not providing for complete field locate.  General vicinity of flowline location provided.  Well was not producing at time of line strike.
properties.Preventative Measure: Tracer wire was repaired to avoid future missed locate.

properties.Spill_Desc: While potholing for a developer, the hydrovac operator too aggressively hit our flowline and caused a release of produced water and crude oil to the surface.
properties.Root Cause: Third party, private hydrovac utility clearance contractor damaged line during utility clearance operations for a separate flowline P&A project.
properties.Preventative Measure: Flowline P&A contractor will initiate corrective actions.

properties.Spill_Desc: Operator has been working on wells for several weeks. Today he heard gas as the wells were being turned in. Wells are now Shut-In, operator exposed the Dump-line to find a hole in the line. No standing fluid on surface.

properties.Operator Name: KERR MCGEE OIL & GAS ONSHORE LP
properties.Spill_Desc: On October 17, 2022, soil impacts were discovered during the removal of the flowline associated with the PSC 43-11A wellhead. Excavation and assessment activities are ongoing. A topographic Site Location Map showing the geographic setting of the release is provided as Figure 1.
properties.Root Cause: Soil impacts were discovered during the removal of the flowline associated with the PSC 43-11A wellhead.
properties.Preventative Measure: Site infrastructure has been removed and will not be replaced. Ensure standard operating procedures for flowline removal are followed.

properties.Spill_Desc:
Produce water was being rerouted to an above ground line, to the south east of location. A valve was accidentally left open, resulting in a spill down the bar ditch and into the
pipeline ROW. The valve was quickly closed, and water trucks were called to remove any standing water.
properties.Root Cause: The incident was due to a valve incorrectly being left open without a bull plug present in the valve.  The line was shut in and a bull plug was installed in the valve.
properties.Preventative Measure: Continue to conduct proper pre-startup safety checks within the pipeline.

properties.Spill_Desc: Operator was on location and identified moisture on the ground, which was determined to be an underground line leak. Still in the investigation process to determine which line and volume.
properties.Root Cause: The incident was caused by bacterial internal corrosion of the pipeline.
properties.Preventative Measure: Caerus is in the process of determining a plan forward with corrosion resistant material for the carbon steel line.

properties.Spill_Desc: Operator was on-site checking the dumps, when he heard a bubbling sound. Upon further investigation, he found a leak in the 5B dump line. Further investigation is needed to determine volume and specifics.

The field superintendent was investigating a hydrocarbon odor near the Krause Tank Battery. Produced water from a flowline between the MSSU 19-5 (API 05-069-06301-00) and the Krause water injection plant was discovered in the open, vacant field used for radio/satellite towers. The release was stopped by closing the valve at the well and at the water plant at the Krause Battery. NG Companies will be removing impacted soil from the spill location.
Bad fuse spot on poly pipe.   Line was isolated and evacuated and repaired.  Soil samples taken and sent in for analysis.
Leak was found by hunters in the area.  Landowner called to area supervisor to inform company.   Line was isolated and evacuated.   Bad poly fuse was removed and repaired/replaced.

During transfer operations a high pressure gauge failed at the threads inside the manifold building at Middle Fork Water Treatment Facility. The released water collected inside the concrete sump of the  manifold building. Upon discovery the operator shut down operations and when it was safe to do so he replaced the failed guage. A water truck was dispatched and all of the lost fluid was recovered from the sump.

properties.Operator Name: BONANZA CREEK ENERGY OPERATING COMPANY LLC
properties.Spill_Desc: Internal corrosion resulted in the formation of a pinhole leak on the produced water transfer system (478498) running from the State Pronghorn CPF 41-32 to NGL's C-11 disposal well. Upon discovery, the line was immediately shut-in, evacuated of remaining fluids, and locked out. Production trends estimate the release to be 30 bbls. The line is scheduled to be repaired and pressure tested prior to returning to service. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to a COGCC approved disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected and submitted for laboratory analysis. Analytical results will be provided in subsequent report.
properties.Root Cause: Internal corrosion resulted in a pinhole forming at the 12 o'clock position on a 90° fitting of a carbon steel line.
properties.Preventative Measure: Along with annual pressure tests and a robust chemical integrity program, BCEI will be replacing the section of carbon steel with stainless steel.

properties.Spill_Desc: While conducting a routine pressure test on the 12C well's flowline, the lease operator observed a pressure loss which led him to report the incident via Caerus' internal notification process. The line was de-energized and isolated. Once the failure point is identified, an environmental assessment will be conducted.

Surface/Business Owner contacted KPK about liquid surfacing in storage yard.  KPK responded and isolated segment of flowline between McDonald #2 well and flowline manifold just south of McDonald #1 well.  Liquid pooled within lot space no. 6 approximately 30 sq ft of surface impact.

Laramie discovered potential release at approximately 10 am and field verified at 11 am. The valve cans near the entrance to the Gunderson 20-03 pad had a problem that has yet to be determined. Produced water was seen exiting the valve cans and entering the stormwater controls around the pad. The produced water than left the stormwater controls and flowed downhill across the Gunderson property towards Buzzard Creek. Release was immediately controlled and fluid recovery began at 11 am with two recovery trucks. One truck began recovering fluid from the can and the another truck began recovery from two recovery trenches that were dug near Buzzard Creek. 3 spill trailers were on location and booms were placed in several locations along Buzzard Creek. Surface water samples were collected along Buzzard creek at 5 downstream locations.
Operator came on location and noticed liquids at surface near the dump line, operator completed a pressure test of dump line which failed. Isolated the dump line and reported to EHS on call.

A produced water recycle line was accidentally struck releasing 170 barrels of produced water. An earthen berm was immediately constructed around spill area and the line was shut in. 135 bbls of produced water was recovered via hydrovac and a remedial excavation was begun immediately, removing 175 cubic yards of soil.
The 2" pump recirculation line froze within the tank battery and spilled into secondary containment mixing with snow and ice. All free fluid is being recovered via vac trucks.

Operator discovered line leaking approximately 1:06 pm and and shut in and contained it at 1:30pm. Standing liquids were removed by vac truck and spill path is being water washed. Leak was on a 3 inch fiberglass flowline. All proper notifications were made.
properties.Root Cause: Operator discovered line leaking approximately 1:06 pm and and shut in and contained it at 1:30pm. Standing liquids were removed by vac truck and spill path is being water washed. 3 inch fiberlgass line failed.
properties.Preventative Measure: Replace section of line and pressure test .

properties.Spill_Desc: The LDAR team was conducting FLIR inspections on the well pad when they identified gas leaking near the separator.  The gas was leaking from the gas pipeline lateral between the separator and pig launcher on location.  The wells were shut in to control the incident.

operator went to location, found water surfacing near tanks. operator performed a dump line pressure test to check for line failure. dump line had failed and operator isolated the line. then call Caerus EH&S oncall through OCC

operator was traveling to location 32-33 and noticed produced water surfacing.  he call OCC and initiated the EH&S oncall. and proceeded to isolating the 4 inch produced water line and stopped the release.

A flowline located in/adjacent to existing tank battery froze and released approximately 10-15 bbls of produced water/oil onto existing lease and lease road.
The release was stopped shortly after it occurred. All existing, assumed impacted soils will be segregated onsite via excavation for disposal to county landfill because of relatively low chloride levels at location. The assumption of disposal method will be confirmed with prior analytical. All excavated areas will be refilled with new soils and gravels from an exterior location.

A weld on a produced water loadline failed resulting in approximately 250 bbls of a produced water and crude oil combination being released inside of a lined secondary containment. Vac trucks were dispatched to being removing the pooled fluid. The integrity of the liner will be verified prior to replacing ballast material. If impacts are discovered beneath the liner, the soil will be removed and confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1.

A compromised produced water load line released approximately 50 bbls of produced water to the pad surface. The release was completely contained to the pad surface. Vac trucks are en route to begin removing the remaining fluid. Upon clearance of utility locates, the impacted soil will be removed and confirmation soil samples will be submitted for laboratory analysis in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1.
Yesterday at 1pm a valve going to the maintenance line from the heater treater froze and split, causing 5.1 bbl. oil to release to the ground.  Cleanup has commenced.

While conducting routine location inspection and maintenance on December 26, 2022, fluids were noted on the surface near the heater treater along the path of the production wellhead line (Flowline ID: 477248) for the Yeamans #1 Wellhead. The wellhead and facility have been shut-in pending repairs to the flowline, and surface fluids will be removed with hydro-vacuum. The vertical and horizontal extents will be pursued with conventional excavation, and clearance samples will be collected from the base and sidewalls of the excavation.

PDC discovered a reportable spill at the Sanford 21-29 Pad near the 6N separator. The source of the spill is controlled and was inside secondary containment. The volume and cause of the spill is being determined.  Spill clean-up and delineation activities are underway.
LACT pipeline freeze caused a release of produced water..  Spill delineation and clean-up activities are underway.
Lease operator identified a flowline failure through trending, and confirmed through a pressure test. Well was shut in and proper notifications were completed.
Small leak in Rice #4 flowline discovered by field personnel,  Well immediately shut-in and flowline isolated..
properties.Root Cause: Small flowline leak resulting from external flowline corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: Flowline will be replaced as soon as possible and the existing flowline abandoned.

properties.Spill_Desc: A water injection leak that occurred at 10 PM on 1/7/2023. The leak was on the water lateral that feeds the AC McLaughlin 17 and AC McLaughlin 91 right off of the AC McLaughlin 14 location. The leak was found and shut in at the isolation valve. All proper notifications were made.
properties.Root Cause: 4 inch cement lined injection piping failure due to corrosion
properties.Preventative Measure: Will be replaced with new piping and pressure tested.

properties.Spill_Desc: The operators had been having difficulty with the 6D well on the J27 since Enterprise had gone down and sent line pressure up to 500 psi. The operators had made multiple efforts to restore this well to the forecasted production, but nothing they tried could get the well back to the expected flow. A pressure test was conducted and the flowline failed the test. The well was shut in and notifications were made.
properties.Root Cause: The incident occurred from internal corrosion of a short radius ninety degree fitting.
properties.Preventative Measure: The failed flowline fitting will be replaced with a long radius ninety degree fitting to prevent reoccurrence.

properties.Spill_Desc: Field technician discovered produced water within a heater treater building. It was determined an underground produced water line was leaking releasing an unknown volume of produced water. The location was immediately shut in and additional site investigation activities are being scheduled.
properties.Root Cause: A heater treater water dump line produced water tie developed a hole due to bacterial induced corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: Additional NDE inspections were conducted on above ground piping to assist in assessing the condition of the system. No additional significant corrosion was discovered. Follow up inspections will be performed on above ground piping to continue efforts to proactively mitigate corrosion.

properties.Operator Name: BONANZA CREEK ENERGY OPERATING COMPANY LLC
properties.Spill_Desc: A maintenance roustabout crew was installing a two-inch check valve on a produced water dumpline riser when the line parted at the fiberglass to steel transition releasing approximately 5 bbls of produced water to the pad surface. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to a COGCC approved disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected and submitted for laboratory analysis in compliance with Table 915-1. Analytical results will be provided in a subsequent report.
properties.Root Cause: A maintenance roustabout crew was installing a two-inch check valve on a produced water dumpline riser when the line parted at the fiberglass to steel transition releasing approximately 5 bbls of produced water to the pad surface.
properties.Preventative Measure: Routine AVO inspections occur at all oil and gas facilities. Bonanza Creek operators are trained to inspect equipment during routine walkthroughs. If equipment is found to be damaged, it should be addressed immediately.

properties.Spill_Desc: An individual noticed fluid coming from a valve on the produced water recycle line near the Booth Pad.  Line was immediately shut-in, repair made and clean up is underway.
properties.Root Cause: A valve failed on a produced water recycle line causing approximately 5 bbl. to be released to the ground.

properties.Spill_Desc: The Lease Operator arrived on location and noticed some bubbling on the pad surface. Rain had been falling for most of the day. He conducted a pressure test on the dump-line and the line failed. This line was recently replaced with stainless, another failure on the same line occurred at 1 of the stainless welds a few weeks ago. The operator suspects this occurrence is likely also a failed weld. Construction has been notified. The line was LOTO and the event was reported to OCC.
properties.Root Cause: The root cause has been determined to be a bad weld on the elbow where the line transitions from below ground to above ground at the tank battery.
properties.Preventative Measure: The entire dumpline between the production separator and the production tank battery has been removed so all welds can be assessed for integrity.

properties.Spill_Desc: During normal operations it was noted that line pressure had dropped off slightly and the pump rate had increased. The system was then shut in and the leak was identified in above ground section of piping with an estimated loss of 5 - 10bbls of produced water. Due to depths of snow in area, visibility of release was noticed on a small section on back side (northwest) of piping where it traveled on working surface approximately 50' towards Pond 4.
properties.Root Cause: Crack in "T" above ground piping (pics pending)
properties.Preventative Measure: to ensure no leaks, cygnet must be monitored daily to ensure proper flow rates.

properties.Spill_Desc: At approximately 1:30 PM, pumper found the line broken at the inlet to the water tank. The valve at the inlet of the water tank failed due to freeze. It’s estimated that all 120 bbls produced water plus yesterday’s production of 30 bbls produced water spilled within the tank’s lined containment area. A truck was called to capture as much spilled water as possible, although the water is mostly frozen. Spill has been contained and valve has been replaced.
properties.Root Cause: Produced water low-flow line near storage tank ruptured due to lack of heat tracing.
properties.Preventative Measure: Low-flow line was permanently removed from service.

properties.Spill_Desc: During normal operations; lease operator noticed standing fluid within lined containment of the 608-41 tank battery. The location/tank was isolated/shut in and water trucks were dispatched to remove fluids. Approximately 67 barrels of fluid released within lined containment and 70 barrels recovered. No staining or fluids noted outside of lined containment in snow. Likely suspect is corrosion within tank, further root cause will be established today or this week and supplied in Supplemental Form 19.
properties.Root Cause: Likely cause was from freezing temps causing the nipple to not function correctly.
properties.Preventative Measure: Daily checks on equipment to ensure proper working order is established along with cygnet system checks on routes to ensure leaks/pressures not lost.

properties.Operator Name: KERR MCGEE OIL & GAS ONSHORE LP
properties.Spill_Desc: On January 27, 2023, a release of a vaporized hydrocarbon mists of approximately 10 gallons that left the location was discovered at the Bartez 21-17 wellhead. Due to simultaneous operations being completed at the site, excavation and assessment activities have been delayed but are ongoing. A topographic Site Location Map showing the geographic setting of the release is provided as Figure 1.
properties.Root Cause: The supply gas check valve failed.
properties.Preventative Measure: The check valve was repaired and the well is shut in.

properties.Spill_Desc: KPK Pumper was activating the Anderson 22-32 well the afternoon of Friday 1/27/23 when he identified the release along the wellhead access road from the tank battery around 2pm.  The well was deactivated and the line isolated by the pumper.  Spill release personnel arrived to begin removal of impacted soil.  Agency and landowner notifications were made that afternoon.  As of 2/2/23, utility locates completed, impacted soil berm constructed, and site prepared for excavation activities.  Once adjacent buried electrical utility found, excavation of flowline release and daylighting of flowline release point will begin.
The operator arrived on location and discovered gas bubbling at the surface below the dumpline. The well was shut in and the dumpline was isolated.
properties.Root Cause: The failure was due to internal corrosion of the dumpline.
properties.Preventative Measure: The dumpline will be replaced with non-corrosive material for future operation.

properties.Spill_Desc: All distances above were obtained from the COGCC online GIS system. Depth of impact (line failure) was approximately 5' below grade Soil samples will be taken to show vertical and horizontal delineation. Additional soil samples will also be taken along spill path and areas. All standing liquids were removed with a vac-truck. Area will be water washed with fresh, clean water from the main water plant.
properties.Root Cause: 8'' coated spool failed due to internal corrosion
properties.Preventative Measure: Spool was replaced with Stainless Steel and pressure tested.

properties.Operator Name: KERR MCGEE OIL & GAS ONSHORE LP
properties.Spill_Desc: On January 12, 2023, approximately 0.7 barrels of fluid were released due to a failed line to the lease automatic custody transfer (LACT) unit at the Camp 13 3N 28 29N-25HZ Production Facility location. During subsequent cleanup activities on February 1, 2023, the release became State Reportable due to the quantity of impacted soil removed from the release area. Cleanup and site assessment activities are ongoing.
properties.Root Cause: A release was discovered due to a failed line to the lease automatic custody transfer (LACT) unit at the Camp 13 3N 28 29N-25HZ Production Facility location.
properties.Preventative Measure: The integrity of the facility infrastructure will be verified, and any affected equipment will be repaired and/or replaced.

properties.Spill_Desc: During routine pad check-ins. A spot was noticed off of road that had snow melt in a 5' circle. The compressor station was shut in, emergency locates called in, and was excavated to locate pin hole within pipe. Root cause appears to be from external to internal from outside rock rubbing on pipeline. Repairs are scheduled to fix hole and get system back to online.  Grab sample was collected of source material released and a soil sample of the point of release.
properties.Root Cause: After failure point removal, corrosion appears to be the cause.
properties.Preventative Measure: Monitoring of pressures on Cygnet and pressure testing.

properties.Spill_Desc: On 2/3/2023 at approximately 1:45pm, the lease operator noticed oil and produced water surfacing above the flowline corridor. The facility was immediately shut in and the leak stopped surfacing. All fluid was contained on surface.  A vac truck was brought in and removed approximately 5 bbls of free liquids from the surface. Based on production numbers, approximately 13 bbls of oil and 6.5 bbls of produced water were released.  Upon investigation, it was determined that a pre-fabricated 90 on the Schlotthauer 23E-20-13C 2" flowline had been compromised due to internal corrosion. Clean up operations are underway and additional information will be provided on a supplemental report.
properties.Root Cause: On 2/3/2023 at approximately 1:45pm, the lease operator noticed oil and produced water surfacing above the flowline corridor. The facility was immediately shut in and the leak stopped surfacing. All fluid was contained on surface. A vac truck was brought in and removed approximately 5 bbls of free liquids from the surface. Based on production numbers, approximately 13 bbls of oil and 6.5 bbls of produced water were released. Upon investigation, it was determined that a pre-fabricated 90 on the Schlotthauer 23E-20-13C 2" flowline had been compromised due to internal corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: The flowline has been repaired and is back in operation.

properties.Spill_Desc: During a routine site walk at the SLW Ranch B12-65-1HN Tank Battery a field specialist found that a 2” screw style Balon valve had frozen causing a release of approximately 5 barrels of produced water. The 2” line the valve was on was immediately shut in and clean-up response was initiated.
properties.Root Cause: During a routine site walk at the SLW Ranch B12-65-1HN Tank Battery a field specialist found that a 2” screw style Balon valve on a water dump line had frozen causing a release of approximately 5 barrels of produced water.
properties.Preventative Measure: The 2” line the valve was on was immediately shut in and clean-up response was initiated. The plan is to replace the screw style valve with the bolted body for separators on this location and others in the coming months.

properties.Spill_Desc: A leak occurred on the lateral injection line for Fee 93 at approx. 4:00am it was discovered and shut in at the isolation valve at approx. 4:45am. All proper notifications were made. Spill path will be water washed with fresh water obtained from the main water plant.
properties.Root Cause: 3 inch coated spool failure due to internal corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: Spool will be replaced with a 3 inch schedule 80 stainless steel spool and pressure tested prior to return to service.

properties.Spill_Desc: A valve on an oil proving loop froze and split causing a release of 0.8 barrels of oil to the ground. 10 cubic yards of soil have now been removed during clean up activities. Remedial excavation has been guided by laboratory analysis of confirmation soil samples.
properties.Root Cause: Dumpline failure due to corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: Underground lines are being abandoned and above ground lines are being installed to better monitor for corrosion and allow quicker and easier clean up and repair.

properties.Spill_Desc: While drilling ahead in the production hole section at 7,005’, a 4” cap on a mud line failed due to freezing causing 100bbls of fresh water-based drilling fluid to spill. The mud line comes off the sand trap underneath the rig shakers that is used to pull mud into the solids control centrifuge or back over the shakers for further processing. The cap was used against a camlock fitting to seal off an unused ‘tee’ connection within the 4” hose. The ‘tee’ connection had a suspected ice plug in it which caused the cap to eventually fail. The spill occurred over a 10min period where it was caught, and the line was shut in. The spill was primarily located between the rig mud tanks and the solids control equipment. The spill was 100% contained on location by 1st (metal containment between equipment) and secondary containment (HDPE below equipment). Free fluid was recovered immediately with an on-site vac and put back within the system.
properties.Root Cause: Frozen "T" within piping caused cap to crack and fail.
properties.Preventative Measure: Recommendation to utilize hammer union (Steel) fittings for freezing temps instead of cam lock plastic. Routine checks on all equipment necessary.

properties.Spill_Desc: It was reported that gas could be smelled at SGV Murray location. LDAR team went to the location and investigated the reported issue. Upon arrival, it was quickly discovered there was gas seeping near the entrance of location. EH&S on-call was initiated, as well as operators to identify and isolate the release. Operators isolated line in question. The line bled to zero psi, and LDAR team could no longer see gas seeping from the ground.

2" valve on the side of a 20" line into the de-gas unit froze and cracked, causing a release of gas and fluid. Spill is contained on location.  Volume to be determined. Line is shut in but the residual in the line is what is spraying out.
properties.Root Cause: The valve and flange were separated due to freezing fluid in the line.
properties.Preventative Measure: The valve will be replaced and the pipeline will be pigged to remove excess fluid in the system.

properties.Operator Name: KERR MCGEE OIL & GAS ONSHORE LP
properties.Spill_Desc: On February 11, 2023, a release of approximately 1 bbl was discovered at the Meese 16N Jaguar 3C-14HZ O SA facility location. Excavation and assessment activities are currently ongoing. A topographic Site Location Map showing the geographic location setting of the release is provided as Figure 1.
properties.Root Cause: Water dumpline failed resulting in a release that daylighted.
properties.Preventative Measure: The water dumpline will be repaired.

properties.Spill_Desc: frozen valve on tank thawed out during the war weekend, and release approximately 100bbls into a line secondary containment. operators in area have already removed standing fluid from containment.
properties.Root Cause: The root cause was determined to be a valve left open by a contract water operator.
properties.Preventative Measure: Contractors will be reminded of operational procedures and consequences of not following them.

properties.Operator Name: BONANZA CREEK ENERGY OPERATING COMPANY LLC
properties.Spill_Desc: During routine inspections, an operator discovered an open valve coming off the recycle pump discharge line that resulted in approximately 35 bbls of oil being released entirely within lined secondary containment. There are currently no impacts to the ground surface. The pooled fluids and impacted pea gravel material has been removed and hauled to a COGCC approved disposal facility. The integrity of the liner was confirmed to be in good condition.
properties.Root Cause:
During routine inspections, an operator discovered an open valve coming off the recycle pump discharge line that resulted in
approximately 35 bbls of oil being released entirely within lined secondary containment.
properties.Preventative Measure: Bonanza lease operators are coached to conduct routine thorough inspections of all equipment. If any issues are found during walkthroughs, they should be addressed immediately.

properties.Spill_Desc: PDC discovered some condensate that was pushed up from the subsurface from an underground flowline.  The flowline was immediately locked out and repairs and clean up initiated.
properties.Root Cause: The pipe was open ended and not attached.  Once the pipe was pressurized, it daylighted. The pipe was attached to the main condensate drain line that comes off the VRU and pressure tested.
properties.Preventative Measure: Attention to detail

properties.Spill_Desc: Automation indicated that a release of approximately 56 barrels of produced water occurred at the Wolfpack Econode. A site investigation will be conducted to confirm the release and begin remedial efforts if necessary.
properties.Root Cause: A dump line developed a leak due to corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: All underground dump lines at the facility will be abandoned and converted to above ground lines. These lines will be more easily visually monitored for external corrosion and equipment failure.  Additionally these lines will be monitored for bacteria and other causes of internal corrosion.

properties.Operator Name: BONANZA CREEK ENERGY OPERATING COMPANY LLC
properties.Spill_Desc: A compromised produced water line resulted in a currently unknown volume of fluid being released to the ground and subsurface. Upon discovery, the line was immediately shut in and the spill was contained entirely on pad. Surface fluids are currently being cleaned up and the line has been scheduled to be exposed and repaired. Upon repair, the line will be pressure tested prior to returning to service. This release became reportable when the volume could not be immediately determined due to the release daylighting from the subsurface in accordance with Rule 912.b.(1).G. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to an approved COGCC disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1. The location lies within the mapped High Priority Habitat for Mule Deer Winter Concentration Area.
properties.Root Cause: A compromised produced water line resulted in a currently unknown volume of fluid being released to the ground and subsurface.
properties.Preventative Measure: Routine AVO inspections occur at all oil and gas facilities.

properties.Spill_Desc: operator found dump line failure while working on location, operator isolated dump line and wells associated, operator initiated EH&S on call.
properties.Root Cause: Upon excavation of the release point via hydro-vac, it was determined that the dump line had failed at the first 90 due to internal corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: Following repair of the dumpline, additional components will be upgraded with new steel and the chemical treatment program will be evaluated.

properties.Spill_Desc: Flowline from LN Hagood A10X well failed spilling fluids to the ground.  Fluids entered a dry drainage.  Leak was controlled within 15 minutes, line was isolated and all proper notifications were made.  Clean up and fluid recovery is currently be done at site.
properties.Root Cause: Flowline from LN Hagood A10X well failed spilling fluids to the ground.  Cause of failure was was joint failure on 4 inch fiberglass line.
properties.Preventative Measure: entire line from well to failure joint will be replaced and pressure tested. (approximately 80 feet)

properties.Spill_Desc: On 2-14-2023, less than 1 barrel of produced fluid was released from the wellhead.  Clean up was immediately initiated and on February 17, more than 10 CY of impacted soil was removed.
properties.Root Cause: Valve unintentionally left partially open and plug was not in place to prevent release.
properties.Preventative Measure: Attention to detail training.

properties.Operator Name: KERR MCGEE OIL & GAS ONSHORE LP
properties.Spill_Desc: On 2/22/23, a release of approximately 6 bbls was discovered at the SBJ 22-13 HZ O SA location. Back-hoes were used to begin recovery of the surface impacts and as a precaution, absorbent booms were deployed into the Little Thompson River after a slight sheen was observed. On 2/22/23, 3 surface water samples were collected upstream, adjacent, and downstream (SW-01 - SW-03) of the release location from the Little Thompson River. Lab analytical results of BTEX, naph., 1,2,4-TMB, and 1,3,5-TMB were non-detect in samples SW-01 - SW-03. On 2/23/23, hydrovacs were used to begin recovery of impacts around the facility equipment. Site assessment and remedial activities are ongoing and will be summarized in a Supplemental Form 19 Spill/Release Report. A topographic Site Location Map showing the geographic location setting of the release is provided as Figure 1. A Site Map depicting the release and sample locations is attached as Figure 2. Analytical results are summarized in Tables 2 through 6.
properties.Root Cause: A cyclonic valve failed from being washed out due to sand.
properties.Preventative Measure: The cyclonic valve will be replaced.

properties.Spill_Desc: A waterline in a can ruptured, causing spill which left the location and entered an intermittent drainage. Line was shut in, and a vac truck removed 20 bbl from the containment. The intermittent drainage had a dry are (with snow cover) where the spill entered. Further down was standing water (likely snow melt). We do not believe the spill reached the standing water, but samples were collected and wattles were deployed.
properties.Root Cause: The identified failure is categorized as a line rupture.  No freezing or over pressure conditions were noted at the time of the incident.  Caerus believes the line failure was due to a weakened section of pipeline.
properties.Preventative Measure: Caerus will replace the section of failed pipeline with corrosion tolerant pipe to prevent reoccurrence.  Caerus will continue to inspect the pipeline within the can on regular intervals to ensure degradation is identified as soon as possible.

properties.Spill_Desc: During normal operations a fire was reported within tank battery at site. Location was shut in allowing the fire to extinguish itself. Unknown amount lost due to fire consumption and leftover within tanks. Recovery within lined containment was 35bbl. Released fluids that escaped lined containment froze on working surface.
properties.Root Cause: Initial root cause is suspect failure in manifold piping, hole identified after fire. (unknown if caused by fire or if is root)
properties.Preventative Measure: Daily checks on sites, cygnet watch, ensure equipment is working properly.

properties.Spill_Desc: A compromised air bleed valve on the produced water pump manifold resulted in approximately 5 bbls of produced water to be released outside containment to the ground surface. The spill was contained entirely on the pad surface and a hydrovac truck was dispatched to the location to remove standing surficial fluids. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to an approved COGCC disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1. A notification has been sent to CPW since the area is located within proposed 2023 Mule Deer Winter Concentration High Priority Habitat area.
properties.Root Cause: A compromised air bleed valve on the produced water pump manifold resulted in approximately 5 bbls of produced water to be released outside containment to the ground surface.
properties.Preventative Measure:
Lease operators are coached to inspect equipment and components during facility walkthroughs. If worn components are identified,
they should be immediately replaced.

properties.Spill_Desc: A small volume of produce fluids containing both produced water and condensate was discovered to have come to surface at a dump line riser at the eastern-most production unit. Although the estimated volume of fluids that came to the surface is less than 1 bbl, a review of production records indicate that the total volume released is likely between 5 and 10 bbls. The fluid that came to surface is localized to an area measuring approximately 2’ x 6’ immediately surrounding the dump line riser.  All of the fluids stayed on the pad, and there were no off-site impacts as a result of this incident.
properties.Root Cause:
The source of the release is from a hole on the combined oil dump line extending from the separator furthest to the south identified with wells GM 412-23 /  GM 433-32 / GM 13-23 / GM 313-23. 
The position of the hole is approximately in the 7:00 position.
properties.Preventative Measure: TEP is removing buried dump lines and replumbing them above ground for ease of operations and inspections, as well as prevent below ground surface incidents from occurring.

properties.Spill_Desc: Upon arrival on location, a lease operator detected gas coming from the area near the 15D-14 well's wellhead.  The well and associated flowlline was isolated and the gas was verified immediately to be coming from the soil adjacent to the wellhead mentioned above.  The failure point of the flowline was identified on 3/7/2023 via daylighting of the area where the gas was assumed to be coming from.  The failure point is the first below ground ninety degree elbow where the flowline transitions at the wellhead from above ground to below ground.  This ninety degree elbow and the next one downstream will be replaced.  Once the repair is complete and it is safe to do so, the soil adjacent to the failure point will be assessed for impacts.
properties.Root Cause: The root cause was determined to be internal corrosion at the first below ground ninety degree elbow where the flowline transitions at the wellhead from above ground to below ground.
properties.Preventative Measure: This ninety degree elbow and the next one downstream will be replaced.

properties.Operator Name: KERR MCGEE OIL & GAS ONSHORE LP
properties.Spill_Desc: On February 28, 2023, approximately 0.11 barrels of fluid were released due to a leak from the hammer union on the bypass line at the Aggregate State 24 22 25-9 O SA Production Facility location. During subsequent cleanup activities on March 6, 2023 the release became State Reportable due to the quantity of impacted soil removed from the release area. A topographic Site Location Map showing the geographic setting of the release is provided as Figure 1.
properties.Root Cause: A release was discovered due to a leak from the hammer union on the bypass line at the Aggregate State 24 22 25-9 O SA Production Facility location.
properties.Preventative Measure: The integrity of the facility infrastructure will be verified, and any affected equipment will be repaired and/or replaced.

properties.Spill_Desc: During normal operations; lease operator noticed a release within lined secondary containment. The location was shut in and recovery was commenced. Likely suspect of corrosion within discharge line in containment failed. Repairs are scheduled to be made. Total lost and recovered will be supplied in supplemental form 19.
properties.Root Cause: Process piping within lined containment failed under insulation. After removal, a hole was noted in discharge line at a "T"
properties.Preventative Measure: continual inspections on equipment and daily checks on cygnet to ensure equipment is in working order.

properties.Spill_Desc: Oxy notified KPK of potential flowline release.  KPK responded to assess, shut-in wells, isolate flowline segment and begin surface clean up.  Surface impact was limited to 20' x 5' area.  No impacts or threat of impact to surface water, wetlands, livestock or occupied structures.  Excavation of impacted soil began on Monday 3/13 after utility locates were completed.
properties.Root Cause: External pinhole corrosion hole on 4" coated steel consolidation flowline at the 9 o'clock position.
properties.Preventative Measure: Install 1,000' of 3" HDPE pipe inside 4" steel.

properties.Spill_Desc: LDAR completed an inspection on location. They identified gas releasing from ground near separators. LDAR initiated EHS on call. operators arrived and isolated release point.
properties.Root Cause: Caerus will provide root cause information once the equipment at the point of release has been identified, excavated, and evaluated.
properties.Preventative Measure: Caerus will provide reoccurrence prevention information once the equipment at the point of release has been identified, excavated, and evaluated.

properties.Spill_Desc: A pinhole in the GP Cody Fed 20E-15-01 separator produced water line resulted in 10 to 15 bbls of fluid to be released to the ground surface. Upon discovery the well was shut in and the water leg was isolated and LOTO. The spill was contained entirely on the pad surface and a vac truck was dispatched to clean up surficial fluids. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to an approved COGCC disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1. Due to depth to groundwater, Extraction requests to use Residential Soil Screening Level Concentrations to show compliance with COGCC Table 915-1.
properties.Root Cause: A pinhole due to internal corrosion in the GP Cody Fed 20E-15-01 separator produced water line resulted in 10 to 15 bbls of fluid to be released to the ground surface.
properties.Preventative Measure: Robust chemical and integrity programs have been implemented company wide.

properties.Spill_Desc: On 3/17/2023 at 2:30pm, a Verdad Operator discovered a release had occurred inside tank containment. An estimated 8 bbls of crude oil was discovered to have leaked out of a recycle line. No fluid was discovered to have left containment. The tank was bottomed out through the load line, and the tank leaked fluid at a lower valve on the recycle line. All free liquid will be sucked up by vac truck and contaminated material will be disposed of via a hydro vac.
properties.Root Cause:
Line at shut in facility had not been inspected or used for too long. Tanks had been mostly bottomed out, but 8 bbls remained above
the recycle line tie in point. When recycle line failed, the 8 bbls drained out. All spilled liquid and impacted pea gravel in
containment was removed via hydrovac. The hydrovac then cleaned the impacted contaiment liner and walls. All spilled, impacted
and cleaning water was collected by hydrovac and properly disposed of. Manifests for disposal attached.
properties.Preventative Measure:
We will increase the frequency of inspection at shut in facilities, evaluate the tank levels at shut in facilities to ensure they are
bottomed out.

properties.Spill_Desc: A compromised isolation valve resulted in approximately 3 bbls of produced water to be released to the ground surface and an unknown volume to the subsurface. Operations were immediately halted, and a vac truck was dispatched to remove the standing surficial fluids. The compromised isolation valve has been scheduled to be repaired. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to an approved COGCC disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1.
properties.Root Cause: A compromised isolation valve resulted in approximately 3 bbls of produced water to be released to the ground surface and an unknown volume to the subsurface.
properties.Preventative Measure: Routine AVO inspections occur at all oil and gas facilities.

properties.Spill_Desc: A COGCC inspector identified gas bubbling within the cellar ring and notified the operator. The well was shut in due to the failed flowline.
properties.Root Cause: Pressure test identified the failed flowline.
properties.Preventative Measure: The flowline will be replaced with corrosion resistant stainless steel.

properties.Spill_Desc:
Gate valve at ground level of flowline froze and cracked; fluids from flowline back-flowed from the header at the tank battery; flow was stopped, valve was replaced.  Vac truck 
recovered 20 bbls of fluid from around the well; backhoe has been called to recover contaminated soil, stockpile and contain for disposal; soil samples will be evaluated as soon as possible.

Per the request and observations of Nikki Graber w/ the COGCC during an inspection on Friday, March 24, this spill report is being submitted.  Nikki's email with observations and photos are attached.  Nikki observed a "visible sheen present" on groundwater at the bottom of the excavation where recent flowline repair/replacement had taken place along with "heavily saturated soils that smelled heavily of hydrocarbons".  Groundwater and soil samples to be collected for analysis to confirm the presence/absence of hydrocarbon impacts.
Fire inside of the separator, which is initially attributed to failed water dump.  Non-PFAS Foam was used to extinguish the fire.
properties.Root Cause: Dump valve stuck open
properties.Preventative Measure: Added equipment for shut down on low fluid level.

properties.Spill_Desc: While trending production data, an anomaly was observed on the 1F-34 well's data. The lease operator conducted a pressure test which failed and inspected several failure points including the stem and seat on one of the valves and found that it was washed out. The equipment was replaced but the line still did not hold pressure. The line was de-energized and isolated. Gas control was then notified of the incident. It is suspected that the failure point is at the first subsurface ninety degree elbow downstream of the wellhead.
properties.Root Cause: While trending production data, an anomaly was observed on the 1F-34 well's data. The lease operator conducted a pressure test which failed and inspected several failure points including the stem and seat on one of the valves and found that it was washed out. The equipment was replaced but the line still did not hold pressure. The line was de-energized and isolated. Gas control was then notified of the incident. It is suspected that the failure point is at the first subsurface ninety degree elbow downstream of the wellhead.
properties.Preventative Measure: The flowline was replaced and upgraded from schedule 80 to schedule 160, epoxy coated, welded 2" steel flowline.

properties.Spill_Desc: Noble responded to repair an underground portion of a back pressure regulator line that was leaking. It was estimated no more than 5 gallons of fluid had been released by the leak. Upon further investigation it has been determined that a significantly larger, unknown amount of fluid had been released. Additional investigative and remedial activities are being planned and conducted now.
properties.Root Cause: A back pressure line was found to be leaking due to corrosion
properties.Preventative Measure: The back pressure line was repaired

properties.Spill_Desc: During fence installation an underground line was damaged.  An unknown quantity of fluid was released.  Operations were immediately shut-in, berms were made around the release area and clean up will commence.
properties.Root Cause: During fence installation an underground line was damaged.
properties.Preventative Measure: The line was immediately exposed and repaired.

properties.Spill_Desc: Operator noticed some changes on cygnet trends and went to location to investigate. Upon arrival he found an underground flow line that was leaking. He isolated the leak which is between the well head and the separator and blew down the pressure. He then notified Gas control and EHS on call.
properties.Root Cause: Operator noticed a change in cygnet trends and went to location to investigate. He found a flow line leak on the 4B well and isolated the leak and blew down the pressure. Reported the incident to the OCC who notified the EHS team
properties.Preventative Measure: The flowline was repaired and upgraded from schedule 80 to schedule 160, epoxy coated, welded, 2" steel flowline.

properties.Spill_Desc: Operator discovered a dumpline at the surface (on working surface of the pad) had come apart. The line was swept and well was shut in.

Laboratory report for monthly voluntary water monitoring program collected on 4/7/23 from the 17L French drain outfall sample location exceeded COGCC allowable level for benzene. Lab report was received on 4/13/23 and notification process was initiated.  The 17L well pad was shut in and pressure testing identified a failed flowline on the Rulison Federal 13C-17 flowline.  Additional surface water monitoring is currently being conducted.
properties.Root Cause: The root cause of the incident is due to internal corrosion of the flowline from the wellhead.
properties.Preventative Measure: Caerus will utilize a non-corrosive material to prevent the reoccurrence of this incident.

properties.Spill_Desc: While conducting pressure testing at the E19 well pad, the lease operator identified a flowline failure in the 7B-24 flowline.  The well was shut in and point of release was excavated.
properties.Root Cause: The incident was caused by internal corrosion at a short-radius ninety degree fitting.
properties.Preventative Measure: The fitting was replaced with a long-radius ninety degree fitting to prevent reoccurence.

properties.Spill_Desc: David Howard (Landowner) notified KPK Field Supervisor of potential flowline release the evening of Thursday 4/13.  KPK dispatched a field crew that confirmed the flowline release and isolated the flowline segment.  The flowline segment is part of the Facility 7 Consolidated Flowline system and internal records indicate that the flowline consists of 12" Carbon Steel with an internal 8" HDPE flowline which has been field verified by excavating the release point and exposing the flowline.  Excavation of impacted soil at the release point is on-going and was initially slowed due to weather and hydrovac activities to locate buried landowner water line in vicinity.
properties.Root Cause: External corrosion hole at 12o'clock position due to disbonded coating on 12" carbon steel pipe approximately 3' from past 8" HDPE to 12" CS transition.
properties.Preventative Measure: Sting 12" carbon steel with 8" HDPE from existing transition point thru adjacent DCP Surrey Compressor Station to KPK's Facility 7 to eliminate future corrosion concern with this segment of line.

properties.Spill_Desc: The lease operator identified a pinhole leak in the discharge line of the Latham 29-17D disposal well.  The well was shut in and proper notifications were completed.
properties.Root Cause: On April 17, 2023, the operator identified a pinhole leak in the discharge line of the Latham 29-17D disposal well. An unknown volume of produced water was released from the discharge line.
properties.Preventative Measure: The line was repaired and inspected prior to being placed back in service. Flowlines are monitored and inspected on a routine basis.

properties.Spill_Desc: While cleaning out the flowline for mineral deposits, a cleaning fluid surfaced.
properties.Root Cause: Mineral deposits impacted the dumpline and PDC used a solution of water and acid to remove the mineral deposits.  During the removal of the mineral deposits, a flowline leak was observed.
properties.Preventative Measure: PDC has updated its process for removal of mineral deposits using less pressure.  PDC has a contractor treating/monitoring the location to prevent or inhibit future mineral deposits.

properties.Spill_Desc: Operator discovered a suspected failed flowline during his site visit. The subject well was shut in. Investigation activities are ongoing.

A compromised line at the AEF 5-61-34-2532BS Separator resulted in a currently unknown volume of fluid to be released to the ground and subsurface. Upon discovery, the line was immediately locked out and the spill was contained entirely on pad. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to an approved COGCC disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1.
properties.Root Cause:
A compromised line at the AEF 5-61-34-2532BS Separator resulted in a currently unknown volume of fluid to be released to the ground
and subsurface.
properties.Preventative Measure: Highpoint has implemented an upgraded chemical program to proactively reduce the number of corrosion related releases.

properties.Spill_Desc: A field technician noticed a spot of fluid while inspecting the Gollner O 27-7 tank battery. Through pressure testing it was determined the fluid was coming from an underground flowline and an unknown quantity of fluid had been released. The line was shut in and investigation/repair has commenced. This location lies within the municipality of Milliken as well as a Bald Eagle Roost site high priority habitat.
While pigging a line residual oil and water mix shot out of a relief valve as a fine mist and drifted off location.
properties.Root Cause: While pigging a line residual oil and water mix shot out of a relief valve as a fine mist and drifted off location.
properties.Preventative Measure: Improved coordination with production team to ensure a fully completed pig run and the purging of the line.

properties.Spill_Desc: A compromised oil dump line on the Maier 1C-28H separator resulted in a currently unknown volume being released to the ground and subsurface. Upon discovery, the line was immediately shut in and the spill was contained entirely on pad. The line was exposed and is scheduled to be repaired. Upon repair, the line will be pressure tested prior to returning to service. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to an approved COGCC disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1.
properties.Root Cause: Internal corrosion on a dump line on the Maier 1C-28H separator resulted in a currently unknown volume being released to the ground and subsurface.
properties.Preventative Measure: Crestone has implemented an upgraded chemical program to proactively reduce the number of corrosion related releases.

properties.Spill_Desc: Caerus identified a sheen emanating on Piceance Creek along a known pipeline corridor.  Caerus initiate immediate spill response procedures, deploying booms in the waterway, started fluid recovery, began Regulatory notification, shut in lines and began pressure testing.

The lease operator identified a dumpline failure on the well pad due to a small hole and dust blowing near the separator.  The lease operator shut in and locked out the dumpline and completed proper notification procedures.
properties.Root Cause: The lease operator identified a dumpline failure on the well pad due to a small hole and dust blowing near the separator. The lease operator shut in and locked out the dumpline and completed proper notification procedures
properties.Preventative Measure: The dumpline has been upgraded to corrosion resistant stainless steel. Annual pressure testing will continue.

properties.Spill_Desc: Pumper pressured up a flowline from 2 nearby wells and oil daylighted at the ground surface. The discovered release by the pumper was noted adjacent to a surface valve approximately 100 feet north of the pumping unit.  The release flowed on the ground surface along the lease road northward for a distance of approximately 135 feet. The wells were immediately shut-in. The impacted surface soil along the lease road and around the surface valve was excavated and transported offsite for disposal. Historical impacts were noted in the subsurface soil near the surface valve. No hydrocarbon staining, odor, or field screening of volatile organic vapors were noted in the soil post-excavation along the lease road. Soil samples were collected near the surface valve and along the lease road post-excavation for submittal to the laboratory for analysis of the Table 915 analytes. The active leak was stopped from the shut-in but the leak point and root cause have not yet been identified.
properties.Root Cause: The leak identified was at the 12 o'clock position on the carbon steel pipe. The leak occurred from corrosion of the steel from the outside in. The leak was detected during a pressurization event from nearby wells by the KPK pumper.
properties.Preventative Measure: A 15' section of HDPE poly pipe was used to replace the leaking section and was installed using a stinger through the existing steel casing.

properties.Spill_Desc: A compromised valve resulted in fluid to be spilled to the ground surface. The spill was contained entirely on pad and a vac truck was dispatched to clean up the surficial fluid, in which 4 bbls were recovered. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to a certified disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1. Due to the release being strictly crude oil, Crestone Peak requests to amend the sampling and analysis plan to only include TPH C6-C36 and Organics Compounds in Soils.
properties.Root Cause: A compromised valve resulted in fluid to be spilled to the ground surface.
properties.Preventative Measure: Lease operators are coached to inspect equipment and components during facility walkthroughs. If worn components are identified, they should be immediately replaced.

properties.Spill_Desc: At 7:00 AM, during a routine site visit at the N22W Pad on 5/15/2023, the operator noticed a wet spot above the dumpline corridor. The dumplines were shut in and a leak was confirmed via pressure testing. The wells will remain shut in and isolated until excavation can occur. A vacuum truck is removing a mixture of produced water and stormwater that has pooled onsite.
properties.Root Cause: Root Cause is still being investigated. Once the point of release is exposed via excavation a determination on failure mechanism will be made.
properties.Preventative Measure: If the compromised dumpline is the point of failure, all site dumplines will be co-mingled and re-built with stainless steel.

properties.Operator Name: BONANZA CREEK ENERGY OPERATING COMPANY LLC
properties.Spill_Desc: A compromised oil dump line resulted in 25 bbls of fluid to be spilled to the surface and a currently unknown volume of fluid to be spilled to the subsurface. A vac truck was immediately dispatched to remove the standing surficial fluids, in which 25 bbls were recovered.  The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to a certified waste disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1. Due to the release being strictly crude oil, Bonanza Creek would like to propose a reduced sampling and analysis plan to only include TPH (C6-C36) and Organic Compounds in Soils.
properties.Root Cause: Internal corrosion of an oil dump line in the 6 o'clock position.
properties.Preventative Measure: Bonanza has implemented an upgraded chemical program to proactively reduce the number of corrosion related releases.

properties.Spill_Desc: This Form 19-S is being submitted to close out the Spill Number under Remediation Project #31160.
properties.Root Cause: A hole was discovered within the produced water line which is assumed to be caused by corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: The water line was removed and replaced per Form 44 Document #403496775.

properties.Spill_Desc: Groundwater monitoring wells were installed down-gradient of the Garden Gulch 8" pipeline release (COGCC Spill/Release Point ID 481814) during 2022 to monitor potential impacts associated with COGCC Remediation Project Number 24488.  During the second quarter of 2023 benzene was identified in groundwater monitoring wells MW02 and MW03.  Sample results are being included in a quarterly report of work completed and will be included in the Supplemental Form 27 under COGCC Remediation Project Number 24488.
properties.Root Cause: Produced water was observed surfacing at the adjacent Latham Laydown Yard. It is estimated that approximately 30 barrels of produced water were released due to the flowline failure. The failed portion of flowline was exposed, and standing fluids were recovered via hydrovacuum truck
properties.Preventative Measure: The failed section of flowline was replaced.

properties.Operator Name: BONANZA CREEK ENERGY OPERATING COMPANY LLC
properties.Spill_Desc: While conducting annual pressure testing operations, a compromised dumpline resulted in a currently unknown volume of produce water to daylight inside the State North Platte P31-T34-26 HNB separator doghouse. The impacted soil will be removed and confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1.
properties.Root Cause: While conducting annual pressure testing operations, a compromised dumpline resulted in a currently unknown volume of produce water to daylight inside the State North Platte P31-T34-26 HNB separator doghouse.
properties.Preventative Measure: Lease operators are coached to conduct AVO inspections and replace/repair aging equipment prior to failure.

properties.Spill_Desc: Failed pressure test at dump line. Volume is currently unknown.  Line is now shut in, and we are investigating volume and exact location.
properties.Root Cause: The dumpline on the location failed the scheduled pressure test. The dumpline was immediately isolated and shut in to control any future release from the dumpline. After further investigation, a small leak was discovered along a lateral section beneath the pad surface near the separator riser.
properties.Preventative Measure: The dumpline will be repaired and returned to service following additional assessment of release extent.

properties.Spill_Desc: Lease operator heard a hissing sound from a below ground salesline.  Line was shut in, and is currently being investigated.
properties.Root Cause: Lease operator heard a hissing sound from a below ground salesline. Line was immediately shut in. Upon further invesitgation, a leak was discovered along a lateral section of line beneath the pad surface just west of the tank battery.
properties.Preventative Measure: The sales line will be repaired and returned to service following additional assessment of release extent.

properties.Spill_Desc: A catch pan on the off-location pigging receiver overflowed due to excessive stormwater resulting in 17 gallons of oil to be spilled to the ground surface and into the neighboring property. This release became reportable when the hydrocarbon fluid left the oil and gas location in accordance with COGCC 912.b.(1).H. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to a licensed waste disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1.
properties.Root Cause: A catch pan on the off-location pigging receiver overflowed due to excessive stormwater resulting in 17 gallons of oil to be spilled to the ground surface and into the neighboring property.
properties.Preventative Measure: The catch pan on the off-location pigging receiver was raised by 3 feet to prevent the pit from overflowing during future storm events. Lease operators are also coached to remove excess fluids on a regular basis to keep fluid levels at a manageable level.

properties.Spill_Desc: On June 5, 2023, KPK identified a gas release along the Facility 9 Consolidation Line (K Section) after responding to a landowner inquiry about stained soil in his plowed field. This sales gas flowline runs south from the UPRR 42 Pan Am K tank battery.  The release location is in the SESW Sec 17 T2N, R66W. The sales gas line has been shut-in and the surface stained soils have been scraped and piled on site. The wet field conditions have halted further excavation at this time. We will investigate the leak and repair the line as soon as the field is accessible. The cause of the release is unknown at this time but is suspected to be corrosion in steel sales gas line.
properties.Root Cause: Unknown at this time. Incident and Root Cause details will be provided when KPK can access the site and expose the flowline.
properties.Preventative Measure: No actions have been taken to date. The flowline is currently shut-in. KPK plans to replace the steel flowline with poly, assuming the flowline is the failure point.

properties.Operator Name: KERR MCGEE OIL & GAS ONSHORE LP
properties.Spill_Desc: On June 7, 2023, a release of an unknown volume of fluid was discovered daylighting from the subsurface at the McKinstry 28N 21N 7C 2N O SA facility location. Site assessment activities are ongoing and will be summarized in a forthcoming Supplemental Form 19 Spill/Release Report. A topographic Site Location Map showing the geographic location setting of the release is provided as Figure 1.
properties.Root Cause: Impacted soils were discovered beneath a water line that failed due to corrosion.
properties.Preventative Measure: The failed water line was replaced.

properties.Spill_Desc: A compromised produced water line resulted in fluid to be released to the ground surface. Upon discovery, the line was immediately locked out and the spill was contained entirely on pad. The impacted soil will be removed and hauled to a licensed waste disposal facility. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1. The location is within Pronghorn Winter Concentration and Mule Deer Severe Winter Range High Priority Habitat.
properties.Root Cause: A compromised produced water line resulted in fluid to be released to the ground surface. Upon discovery, the line was immediately locked out and the spill was contained entirely on pad.
properties.Preventative Measure: Highpoint has implemented an upgraded chemical program to proactively reduce the number of corrosion related releases.

properties.Spill_Desc: During normal operations, plant operator noticed fluid coming from surface riser near HCWTF. The line was shut in and booms were placed along the spill path of the release. The release traveled on surface of pipeline ROW.
properties.Root Cause: Surface line(riser) developed pin hole on underside of piping. Pics attached
properties.Preventative Measure: Further investigation on piping and repairs ongoing. Continual cygnet pressure monitoring and daily checks on equipment to ensure equipment is operating as needed.

properties.Spill_Desc: The Lease operator found stained soil by the lease road and notified KPK. Crews were sent to isolate and blow down the flow line and excavate the impacted soils. The crew was able to uncover the flow line and locate the damaged steel pipe. Corrosion of the steel pipe is the reason of the failure. Further investigation is ongoing.
properties.Root Cause: External corrosion caused the pipe to degrade to a point of failure where its contents released into the surrounding soil. A small corrosion hole was noted at the 12 o'clock position outside inward.
properties.Preventative Measure: The Pipe has been flushed out and will be replaced with High Density Polyethylene Pipe (HDPE). The HDPE Will be stung through an undetermined section of the failed pipeline with a HDPE to Steel transition at each end of the repair.

properties.Spill_Desc: The farmer noted the oil at the ground surface and flagged down KPK's pumper to address the release. The pipeline was immediately isolated and blown down to prevent further contamination. The stained soil was scraped up and hauled off immediately. Further investigation is needed and ongoing. The cause of failure is corrosion to the steel line.
properties.Root Cause:
The farmer noted the oil at the groundsurface and flagged down KPK's pumper to address the release. The pipeline was immediately 
isolated and blown down to prevent further contamination. The stained soil was scraped up and hauled off immediately. Further 
investigation is needed and ongoing. The cause of failure is corrosion to the steel line with a hole at the 12 o'clock position.
properties.Preventative Measure: The steel pipe has been flushed out and will be replaced with High Density Polyethylene Pipe (HDPE). The HDPE Will be stung through an undetermined section of the failed pipeline with HDPE to Steel transitions at each end of the repair.

properties.Spill_Desc: A produced water dump line leak was discovered by a field specialist during routine site inspection. The release is below the tank battery liner and an unknown quantity of fluid was released. All produced water dump lines were immediately shut in and the tanks were bottomed out. This location is within a Pronghorn Winter Concentration high priority habitat.
properties.Root Cause: A dump line leak was identified beneath the produced water above ground storage tank containment, resulting from corrosion.

properties.Spill_Desc: A compromised produced water dumpline resulted in a spill that daylighted to the ground surface. The spill was caught quickly and subsurface impacts are expected to be minimal. The impacted soil will be removed following utility locates and hauled for disposal. Confirmation soil samples will be collected in compliance with COGCC Table 915-1.
